passages.text: Not a great deal to talk out in Rub. Trump's threat to impose extra hard hitting sanctions on Russia seems more like faster than genuine intent, as the implications on global markets would be severe. USD/rub barely batted an eyelid, with the pair trading in an 80.25/50 range. Can't see it changing much again today.

The value date month end dollar bid took USDZAR up through initial resistance at 17.75. This was my first area to fade, although only sold a small amount given price action has not been too encouraging after the false break of 17.50. That being said we are back lower overnight, helped by the offered tone in USDASIA, whilst we also saw some HF ZAR buying yesterday afternoon, albeit small. I still like dollar shorts, but hard to be too engaged until we get the next bout of US data. I do think Fed independence worries will also keep the dollar offered, but a little nervous that this is negative for risk and EM struggles to rally. Hence sold some USDZAR towards 17.75, but with lower conviction.

We maintain our long TRY positions, as the current pace of nominal Try depreciation by state banks continue to realize at the reduced daily pace of 100pips during the week (with current state bank offers at 41.0550). We have been seeing better outflows from the client side this week, as well as MSCI related outflows in market in addition to the usual RHS interest from corporates. The outflows have been mainly offset by state bank offers rather than any fresh inflows from internationals. Following the round trip after the Jackson Hole, the broad dollar seems to be in consolidation mode taking cues from the rates market focusing on the US NFP print next week. Meanwhile, CBT's focus on real TRY appreciation remains an anchor for the long TRY view. In absence of any meaningful local political risk events until mid- September (CHP Court case on \(15^{\text{th}}\) September), this should also assist CBT in anchoring domestic expectations as the easing cycle resumes.

The broad dollar is in consolidation mode with month- end flows dominating the flows this week, while we generally have a preference for weaker dollar. In Ce3, we still have a preference for HUF and CZK over PLN given Poland's widening CA deficit as well as its large fiscal deficit which warrants a higher risk premium for PLN compared to its peers.
Sales & Trading EM FX Daily Report - 28th August 2025 28 August 2025

The last few days EURHUF has been chopping around the 396/398 range and can't say I feel too emboldened to be adding to my core EURHUF short. Wages were hot yesterday and after a hawkish NBH rate cuts continue to get pushed back. Gas is also moving back lower, terms of trade are improving, and unemployment lower this AM, and whilst these are positives for HUFs, they are not necessarily new or the smoking gun to take EURHUF firmly back through 395. With the market nervy (and very choppy) over month end happy to see where the dust settles and stick to just a core long HUF.
Nothing to add to recent commentaries—staying short EURCZK while below the 50- day given the strong fundamentals.
Cross a fair degree higher from 5.0575 to 5.0675. Didn't see the flows here but can only speculate that it was probably corporate right hand side.

Another strong performance from shekel, maybe helped by more month end flows but also assisted by better general usd selling and a decent performance from U.S equities. Spot now down at 3.3350. Should be some short- term support here.

Not overly impressive trading in tense yesterday with usd/KZT pushing up above 539 at one point, having closed at 537 the day before. It has come back a little since then but the performance is so sketchy it hardly engenders any confidence. NBK meet tomorrow and maybe that might be an opportunity for some supportive rhetoric, or even a small hike.
